title: No children nodes listed when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB:
When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there are no children nodes listed. This issue was observed while performing the following steps:

1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. The new data source does not have any database/table/column information.

Actual Result:
No children nodes are listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. If the data set editor is closed and reopened, the issue persists.
EB: The expected behavior is that when the data source is changed, the children nodes of the new data source should be listed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, perform the following steps:

1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Ensure that the new data source does not have any database/table/column information.
3. Open the data set editor page in the query tab.
4. Attempt to change the data source.

Expected Result:
The children nodes of the new data source should be listed.
